body.p: Default settings of keys can be modified by clicking Options => Keys... from the menu bar (it is necessary to activate the translation view).

In order to either change or add a key-assignment, run this process:
In panel "Assign Keys", search the key to be modified, and select it.
Click on button "Assign new key".
Press the key-combination to be used for the key (e.g. ALT+a)
The key assignment takes place immediately. In case of a warning, that this key-combination is already used, chose another key combination.
Finally click on button "Assign".
Assign Keys Window
Figure shows Assign Keys Window

Special characters, such as the copyright sign, can be added to the list of keys:
In panel "Assign Keys", click on button "Add New Character".
The panel "Add New Character" opens.
Clicking on the button "Open Windows Charmap" opens the Windows application "Charmap".
From this panel, select the Font (e.g. "Courier new") as well as the "Special character" (use the button "copy").
Important: the font used in the translation editor must match the font selected in the CHARMAP utility.
In the panel "Add New Character" paste the copied character into field "Char".
The field "Unicode" (a protected field) is automatically filled with the unicode value of the character.
For the user to better understand the special character, a name can be typed into field "Descriptive Name" (e.g. Copyright).
By pressing the button "Add Character", the special character is inserted into the list of keys in panel "Assign Key" (the list is sorted alphabetically, so you find it unter the letter "I").
The final step is to add a key combination to the newly defined special character using the button "Assign new key".

Already existing special characters can either be modified by selecting the key and by clicking on button "Edit Character", or can be deleted by selecting the key and clicking on button "Remove Character".
